title: Women's Football (Sky Sports)
body_text:
The latest news, rumours and gossip from the Women's Super League.
Caroline Weir has been named Scotland Women's captain on a permanent basis.
Chelsea Women manager Sonia Bompastor is adamant the club are still backing her in the wake of their heavy 5-1 defeat to Manchester City on Sunday.
This season has witnessed a changing of the guard in the Women's Super League. A symbolic baton pass happened on Sunday. Chelsea, the six-time defending champions, handed over their title to Manchester City, the champions in wait.
Caitlin Foord's extra-time goal saw Gunners home after VAR sent referee to screen to give Corinthians last-minute penalty
Manchester City opened up an 11-point gap at the top of the Women's Super League table after demolishing defending champions Chelsea 5-1 at the Etihad.
- WSL round-up: Naalsund double sees off Liverpool as Man Utd go second
- Guarino: Meet the Italy legend aiming to reinvigorate West Ham
- Women's Champions Cup: who's playing and how it works
- Wiegman: I never expected it to be like this
- Slegers: Clean sheets can be foundation for Arsenal improvement

- Evertonâ€™s miserable WSL run at Goodison Park continues with Brighton defeat
- CL teams will not compete in Women's League Cup from next season
- Terland punishes 10-player Arsenal as Man Utd reach League Cup final
- Holders Chelsea into seventh straight League Cup final thanks to Keptein header
- Women's FA Cup: Miedema bags brace as Man City progress
- Sky Sports to show Final Stage of inaugural FIFA Women's Champions Cup
- Man City momentum impossible to ignore as Chelsea thump West Ham
- Arsenal miss chance to go second in WSL after draw with 10-player Man Utd
Iman Beney has come a long way since having to travel three hours to attend training sessions as a 12-year-old in native Switzerland.
In conversation with former England international Sue Smith, Adam Bate looks at the challenge facing Hannah Hampton as she replaces Mary Earps in trying circumstances.
Sky Sports News senior reporter Geraint Hughes looks ahead to an exciting year for Wales Women as they join the elite in the Nations League and Euro 2025...
Brazilian forward Kerolin was schooled on the streets of Sao Paulo, playing barefoot with boys. Now Man City's new signing wants to become "the best in the world".
